x-policies.name: Security
x-policies.description: Security policies let you control access to your APIs with OAuth, API key validation, and other threat protection features.

policies.name: validateOauthToken
policies.description: Secure APIs with OAuth

policies.name: cors
policies.description: Enable API’s to support Cross-Origin Resource Sharing requests

policies.name: accesscontrol
policies.description: Lets you allow or deny access to your APIs by specific IP addresses.

policies.name: verifyapikey
policies.description: Lets you enforce verification of API keys at runtime.

policies.name: googleIDToken
policies.displayName: Google ID Token for Target Server
policies.description: Lets you authenticate using Google authentication.

policies.name: clientinfo
policies.description: client information

policies.name: tonikusertoken
policies.description: tonik user token

x-policies.name: Custom Error Handler
x-policies.description: Policy templates related to custom fault handling

policies.name: targetErrorHandler
policies.description: Policy to handle custom error handling for target servers

policies.name: flowErrorHandler
policies.description: Policy to handle custom error handling

x-policies.name: Message Validation
x-policies.description: Validate Request/Response mandatory header and payload

policies.name: requestHeaderCheck
policies.description: Check proxy mandatory header fields

policies.name: paylaodValidation
policies.description: Proxy request schema validation

policies.name: authHeaderCheck
policies.description: Check proxy mandatory authorization header fields

x-policies.name: Mediation
x-policies.description: Mediation policies let you perform message transformation, parsing, and validation, as well as raise faults and alerts.

policies.name: jsontoxml
policies.description: Converts messages from the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format to extensible markup language (XML)

x-policies.name: Threat Management
x-policies.description: Threat management allow you to scan the incoming payloads for any miscellaneous content in the request.

policies.name: jsonThreat
policies.description: Enable payload scan for JSON content

policies.name: xssThreat
policies.description: Scans XSS threats in request header, URI, payload

policies.name: xmlThreat
policies.description: Enable payload scan for XML content

x-policies.name: Logging
x-policies.description: Logging policies allow you to log the request data and response data.

policies.name: log
policies.description: Lets you to log the proxy data during runtime.

policies.name: generateCorrelationId
policies.description: Generate unique correlation Id for E2E tracking

policies.name: generateFlowName
policies.description: Define and track apigee’s current proxy execution flow name

x-policies.name: TrafficManagement
x-policies.description: Traffic management policies let you configure cache, control traffic quotas and spikes, set concurrent rate limits, and so on.

policies.name: spikeArrestEnv
policies.description: Spike Arrest policy protects against traffic spikes.

policies.name: quotaAtProduct
policies.description: Quota policy to configure the number of request messages that an API proxy allows over a period of time.

policies.name: spikeArrestProxy
policies.description: Spike Arrest policy protects against traffic spikes.

policies.name: disablePathsuffix
policies.description: Disable pathsuffix for target routing rule

policies.name: encodeVariable
policies.description: Policy to encode any variable with Base64 encoding

policies.name: decodeVariable
policies.description: Policy to decode any variable with Base64 decoding

policies.name: removeAuthHeader
policies.description: Policy to remove proxy auth header before routing to target server

policies.name: customAnalytics
policies.description: Policy to capture custom analytics

policies.name: complianceCall
policies.description: call to compliance

policies.name: Cacheing Policy
policies.description: Cacheing Policy
